title: [Bypass] Ability to invite a new member in  sandbox Organization

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**
Able to bypass the restriction set in Organization sandbox (automatically created when you created sandbox program) to send an invite to another security researcher.

**Description:**
In the default UI of (sandbox)Hackerone Organization, inviting another security researcher is restricted ex.: https://hackerone.com/organizations/hackycorp_demo/users/invite . 
There is a grayed message:
*You have reached the maximum number of team member invitations for this program. Please contact support@hackerone.com if you need to lift the rate limit.*

But using this  endpoint i found in https://hackerone.com/assets/static/js/30.8f8e2bc5.chunk.js https://hackerone.com/organizations/hackycorp_demo/users/new_invite ==I can send an invite to anyone.==



### Steps To Reproduce
Demo Organization: hackycorp_demo
Test User : 0620  
Invited using: 0620@wearehackerone.com
Real email address: ████

1. Open this URLhttps://hackerone.com/organizations/hackycorp_demo/users/new_invite
2. Type the email address of another security researcher
3. Please see attached video for the demo:
████

## Impact

Bypass the restriction in the sandbox currently configured to send an invite to ane security researcher.

Similar to the report https://hackerone.com/reports/1088966 but on the Organization level.

activities.message: Additional POC I sent an invite to jobert@wearehackerone.com and bluetooth_headset

Hi @0619,

Thank you for your submission. I hope you are well. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.

Have a great day! 

Kind regards,
@tsukuyomix

Hello @0619, I hope you are having a good day!

Thank you for your submission, however, before proceeding with the further assessment of this report, I would like to ask a few questions: 

* How an attacker can leverage this behavior into crafting a real-world or practical exploitation scenario? 

Providing this information will help in quickly validating this report, your input is highly valuable. 


Kind Regards,
@tsukuyomix

Hi @tsukuyomix:
1. Since hackerone placed a restriction to invite any real security researcher in a sandbox Organization and I found a way to bypass that restriction. (currently it's not possible to invite any security researcher {F1629808}
==And i just sent an invite to your email alias tsukuyomix@wearehackerone.com==

 
2. This could allow me to gather the real email address of any security researcher that I invited using the @wearehackerone.com alias (if you will see the attached video I invited 0620@wearehackerone.com after he accepts it it revealed ██████████ (it should stick to 0620@wearehackerone.com IMHO)

3. If you will compare my report to https://hackerone.com/reports/1088966  it is similar but my workaround is ==Organization== level.

4. This endpoint that i found in  https://hackerone.com/assets/static/js/30.8f8e2bc5.chunk.js https://hackerone.com/organizations/<organization name>/users/new_invite  not visible anywhere in Hackerone UI
5.Included in the attached video are the possible task the invited user can do such create an API or Group that can be linked to any Programs under the Organization.


Thank you.
@0619
Hi @0619 - I'm discussing this submission internally with the HackerOne team. You will be updated as soon as there is additional information to share. Thanks for your patience!
@tsukuyomix Thank you, hope to hear again soon. Stay Safe- @0619
Happy Tuesday! @tsukuyomix  Any updates Sir?

Hey @0619!

Thanks for the great report. I've confirmed the behavior you described and escalated this to the internal engineering team responsible for this area of the application. Please let me know if you have any questions!

Thanks,
@cmo
Happy Friday @cmo , do you have any updates Sir?
Hi @0619- We are still looking into this report and will update you when we have additional information to share. Thanks for your patience!
Happy wednesday @cmo  any updates Sir?

Happy Thursday Sirs, @cmo @jobert @bencode
Any updates Sirs?

Thank you.
0619

Hello @0619, I hope you are having a good day!

As I said earlier, we are tracking this report internally and you will be updated whenever we have additional information to share. Thanks for your patience!

Kind Regards,
@tsukuyomix
@cmo, @jobert, @bencode Hello Sirs, my report is in triage status for 2 weeks now. Sorry to ask for any update but i tried the endpoint that i reported and it's no longer valid.
Hey @0619! Sorry for the delay here. Do you mind retesting this and verifying it's now fixed?

The endpoing i found in the .js file is no longer accessible

https://hackerone.com/organizations/hackycorp_demo/users/new_invite
Thank you for the bounty.
